\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
\subsubsection*{template$<$typename eigs\+\_\+\+Algorithm = Persistent\+Laplacians\+::selfadjoint, typename up\+\_\+\+Algorithm = Persistent\+Laplacians\+::schur$>$\newline
class Persistent\+Laplacians\+::\+Persistent\+Laplacian$<$ eigs\+\_\+\+Algorithm, up\+\_\+\+Algorithm $>$}

Primary class for computing persistent Laplacians 
\begin{DoxyTemplParams}{Template Parameters}
{\em eigs\+\_\+\+Algorithm} & Algorithm wrapper class to use for computing eigenvalues of the Laplacian in the spectra family of functions. Default is a wrapper for Eigen\+::\+Self\+Adjoint\+Eigen\+Solver. \\
\hline
{\em up\+\_\+\+Algorithm} & Algorithm wrapper class to use for computing the up-\/\+Laplacian. Default is the Schur complement algorithm presented in Memoli, Wan, and Wang 2020. //\+TODO\+: \textbackslash{}see up\+\_\+algorithms and eigs\+\_\+algorithms \\
\hline
\end{DoxyTemplParams}

\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em boundaries} & a vector of Eigen\+::\+Sparse\+Matrix of type int. Boundaries must be sorted in order of dimension. \\
\hline
{\em filtrations} & a vector of vector of filtrations. filtrations\mbox{[}dim\mbox{]} is a list of all filtrations of simplices in dimension dim. filtrations must be sorted in order of dimension, each filtrations\mbox{[}i\mbox{]} must be sorted in order of filtration\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
Primary constructor. Important Assumptions\+: 1) Boundary matrix has real coefficients stored as integers (but not mod 2!) 2) Boundary matrix dimensions agree with filtrations sizes 3) Length(filtrations) = Length(boundaries) + 1 \mbox{\Hypertarget{classPersistentLaplacians_1_1PersistentLaplacian_ab2f8ae87e04008134820ba126ac25937}\label{classPersistentLaplacians_1_1PersistentLaplacian_ab2f8ae87e04008134820ba126ac25937}}

\mbox{\hyperlink{typedefs_8hpp_aa0b819682f9cdac0ae1234aed46106e6}{Sparse\+Matrix\+\_\+\+PL}} \mbox{\hyperlink{classPersistentLaplacians_1_1PersistentLaplacian}{Persistent\+Laplacians\+::\+Persistent\+Laplacian}}$<$ eigs\+\_\+\+Algorithm, up\+\_\+\+Algorithm $>$\+::get\+\_\+\+L\+\_\+top\+\_\+dim\+\_\+flipped (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{typedefs_8hpp_afc86493f3736a9d186d249149b2e5e22}{filtration\+\_\+type}}}]{a }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}

Get a matrix with the same nonzero eigenvalues as the top-\/dimensional Persistent Laplacian Matrix (by value).

Warning\+: this does a potentially expensive copy. The primary reason this function exists is to provide reasonable python binding access to the matrix itself. If you do not need this matrix directly in python (e.\+g. you want its eigenvalues) it will be more efficient to compute by reference via \mbox{\hyperlink{classPersistentLaplacians_1_1PersistentLaplacian_a27163d1d4c3ca3016927695064c1f8d6}{get\+\_\+\+L\+\_\+top\+\_\+dim\+\_\+flipped(filtration\+\_\+type a, Sparse\+Matrix\+\_\+\+PL \&\+L)}}. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em a} & start filtration value \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A matrix with the same nonzero eigenvalues as the top-\/dimensional persistent Laplacian (but not the persistent Laplacian itself). 
\end{DoxyReturn}

Compute the nonzero eigenvalues of a persistent Laplacian using Schur restriction with the null space, either given by Persistent Homology representatives or by computing the null space.

Set the boundaries and filtrations of a complex, particularly if the default constructor was called. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em boundaries} & a vector of Eigen\+::\+Sparse\+Matrix of type int. Boundaries must be sorted in order of dimension. \\
\hline
{\em filtrations} & a vector of vector of filtrations. filtrations\mbox{[}dim\mbox{]} is a list of all filtrations of simplices in dimension dim. filtrations must be sorted in order of dimension, each filtrations\mbox{[}i\mbox{]} must be sorted in order of filtration. Important Assumptions\+: 1) Boundary matrix has real coefficients stored as integers (but not mod 2!), 2) Boundary matrix dimensions agree with filtrations sizes, 3) Length(filtrations) = Length(boundaries) + 1. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

{\footnotesize\ttfamily template$<$typename eigs\+\_\+\+Algorithm  = Persistent\+Laplacians\+::selfadjoint, typename up\+\_\+\+Algorithm  = Persistent\+Laplacians\+::schur$>$ \\
void \mbox{\hyperlink{classPersistentLaplacians_1_1PersistentLaplacian}{Persistent\+Laplacians\+::\+Persistent\+Laplacian}}$<$ eigs\+\_\+\+Algorithm, up\+\_\+\+Algorithm $>$\+::store\+\_\+spectra (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{std\+::vector$<$ std\+::tuple$<$ int, \mbox{\hyperlink{typedefs_8hpp_afc86493f3736a9d186d249149b2e5e22}{filtration\+\_\+type}}, \mbox{\hyperlink{typedefs_8hpp_afc86493f3736a9d186d249149b2e5e22}{filtration\+\_\+type}}, std\+::vector$<$ \mbox{\hyperlink{typedefs_8hpp_ac240cc0d46f103fa1a410237a0b8853f}{spectra\+\_\+type}} $>$$>$$>$}]{spectra,  }\item[{std\+::string}]{out\+\_\+prefix }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}

Write spectra to files.

for each dimension dim of the complex, files write \char`\"{}\{out\+\_\+prefix\}\+\_\+spectra\+\_\+\{dim\}.\+txt\char`\"{}. Each line of the file is a space-\/separated list of eigenvalues. Lines may be empty. Note the filtration values are not reported.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em spectra} & tuples (dim, a, b, eigenvalues) \\
\hline
{\em out\+\_\+prefix} & Eigenvalues will be written to \char`\"{}\{out\+\_\+prefix\}\+\_\+spectra\+\_\+\{dim\}.\+txt\char`\"{} \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

Write spectra summary to files \char`\"{}\{out\+\_\+prefix\}\+\_\+spectra\+\_\+summary.\+txt\char`\"{}

Each line is a space-\/separated list of filtrations, bettti numbers, and least nonzero eigenvalues\+: (filtration a) (filtration b) (betti 0) ... (betti top\+\_\+dim) (lambda 0) ... (lambda top\+\_\+dim)

\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
